SUPPLIERS

Amaz.Markets understands that success on Amazon depends on the product quality and reliable suppliers. And we know how to help you provide your customers with the best experience.

Why you need a great supplier to run your business on Amazon?

Let's get the facts straight - your supplier is your partner and your greatest support.

Suppliers directly influence the timely fulfillment of your orders.

You need a lot of time and effort to find the best supplier, and investing  in the search for a reliable supplier is the best financing in your business.

Types of Suppliers

Let's focus on the four most popular types of suppliers  for e-commerce businesses: dropshipping suppliers, wholesalers, liquidators, and manufacturers.

Dropshipping suppliers

They are the most popular suppliers for e-commerce businesses. They take care of your inventory and fulfill your orders.

Wholesalers

Wholesalers provide store owners with the opportunity to buy large quantities  of goods at a much lower price. The more goods a customer purchases from  a wholesaler, the more discount they will receive while ordering.

Liquidators

Liquidators make large purchases of overstocks, returns, closeouts, and similar items. Then they resell these items on the market in repackaged bundles of different sizes.

Manufacturers

These suppliers give you the opportunity to purchase goods directly from  the manufacturer. They offer great prices but often require massive minimum orders, meaning you have to pay a lot up front. These suppliers are a great option  for well-known sellers with experience and resources to work with.

What to consider when choosing  a supplier?

There are several factors one should consider when looking for a supplier:

  • fully verified Amazon Seller Account with a professional subscription;

  • connected email;

  • verified Payoneer account with bank statement (by request);

  • VPS for 1 month;

  • documents;

  • QR-code for Amazon 2-step verification.

Our services

Suppliers search

  • We find three manufacturers of the preferred product;

  • We find out the factory prices for 500+ items;

  • We order product samples;

  • We check the quality;

  • We hold talks on good cooperation conditions.

Supplier inspection

  • Our manager in China makes an appointment with the supplier;

  • He goes to the plant/factory/office;

  • He assesses the condition of the equipment, as well  as production conditions;

  • He provides a photo report of the plant capacities;

  • He inspects the goods.

  • Transportation expenses are not included in the service cost.

Goods inspection

  • We check the wholeness and durability  of the package;

  • We check the compatibility of marking and product with layouts;

  • We check the possible defects;

  • We test and scan barcodes and QR-codes;

  • We check the quality of products and assess  the approximate percent of defective items.

Get started

It will take you less than sixty seconds. A member of our team will contact you shortly after.
